symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable
symbols.description: The Gantt Chart control provides a comprehensive set of features to display hierarchical data and visualized shapes together. It's designed to fully support OData binding, declaring hierarchical data and shapes bindings in XML view. It's the recommended control for new applications.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the control.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the control.

properties.name: shapeSelectionMode
properties.description: Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed. The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true.

properties.name: shapeOverRelationship
properties.description:
Specifies whether shape is rendered over relationship or relationship over shape when relationship leads through shape.

If enabled, shapes are rendered over relationships. If disabled, relationships are rendered over shapes.

properties.name: shapeSelectionSettings
properties.description:
A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set. New properties 'shapeColor' and 'fillOpacity' are introduced as of SAPUI5 1.85 release. Using these, you can configure color and opacity of highlighted shapes in a gantt chart. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

properties.name: shapeHighlightSettings
properties.description:
A JSON object containing the shapeHighlightSettings that is used to configure shape highlight styles. If nothing is specified, then the default highlight styles (2px dashed black border) is set. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

properties.name: enableCursorLine
properties.description: Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor

properties.name: enableNowLine
properties.description: Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator.

properties.name: nowLineInUTC
properties.description: Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in FLP time.

properties.name: enableVerticalLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis

properties.name: enableAdhocLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis

properties.name: adhocLineLayer
properties.description: Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns.

properties.name: enableDeltaLine
properties.description: Flag to show or hide Delta Lines

properties.name: enableNonWorkingTime
properties.description: Flag to show or hide non-working time

properties.name: enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight
properties.description: Flag to show or hide Chart Delta Area highlighting

properties.name: deltaLineLayer
properties.description: Specifies the layer on which Delta Lines reside. By default, Delta Lines are above all shapes and patterns.

properties.name: datePattern
properties.description: Specifies how the application's date is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "dd.MM.yyyy" (31.01.2018)

properties.name: timePattern
properties.description: Specifies how the application's time is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "hh:mm a" (12:05 PM)

properties.name: enableExpandedRowBorders
properties.description: Property to enable borders for expanded rows. By default, only row borders are enabled.

properties.name: enableExpandedRowBackground
properties.description: Property to enable the background color for expanded rows. By default, this would show the row background

properties.name: expandedRowHeight
properties.description: Property to define the height of an expanded row in pixels. * @since 1.85

properties.name: dragOrientation
properties.description:
Drag orientation of Gantt Chart. This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:
  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.

properties.name: ghostAlignment
properties.description: The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd

properties.name: showShapeTimeOnDrag
properties.description: Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line. The property takes effect if only one shape is selected or enableMultipleGhosts is set to false.

properties.name: selectionPanelSize
properties.description: The width of selection panel. In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter.

properties.name: displayType
properties.description:
Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.
  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}.

properties.name: disableShapeDoubleClickEvent
properties.description: Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled.

properties.name: showExportTableToExcel
enableSelectAndDrag
properties.description: Allows to drag, drop, and resize a shape on explicitly selecting the shape.

properties.name: deltaAreaHighlightColor
properties.description: Property to add custom color to the highlighted area between delta lines. This would default to Fiori standard color

properties.name: enableLassoInvert
properties.description: Enables inversion on shape selection while drawing lasso

properties.name: showParentRowOnExpand
properties.description: Option to show or hide the parent row on expand. This is applicable only for multi-activity row settings.

properties.name: printingBatchSize
properties.description: Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing.

properties.name: showGanttHeader
properties.description: Option to show or hide the header of the Gantt chart

properties.name: _isAppRunningInRTA
properties.description: Flag to indicate if the app is running in Runtime Adaptation (RTA) mode.

properties.name: snapMode
properties.description: Enables snapping of shapes to attach to the nearest visual element while dragging.

properties.name: snapTimeInterval
properties.description: Defines the least time taken in seconds for a shape to snap while in a particular zoom level. eg. { "4hour":{timeInterval:1800}, ---> 30mins Snap "1hour":{timeInterval:900} ---> 15mins Snap }

properties.name: enableChartOverflowToolbar
properties.description: Option to show or hide the chart overflow toolbar.

properties.name: enableChartSelectionState
properties.description: Option to disable or enable the chart row's selection state.

properties.name: enableChartHoverState
properties.description: Option to disable or enable the chart row's hover state.

properties.name: selectOnlyGraphicalShape
properties.description: Enables selection of only graphical shapes excluding labels.

properties.name: showTextOnGhost
properties.description: Option to show or hide shape labels on ghost while dragging. The property takes effect only when enableMultipleGhosts is set to true.

properties.name: relationshipShapeSize
properties.description: Specifies the size of the relationship's shape. Applicable to triangles, square, diamond, and circle shapes; excluding horizontal rectangle and vertical rectangle shapes.

properties.name: useParentShapeOnExpand
properties.description: Determines if only tasks need to be used for rendering the expanded shapes. Subtasks are not required.

properties.name: findBy
properties.description: Defines the property names for which findAll method should search in different entities

properties.name: findByOperator
properties.description: Defines relationship between the operator and the property names using the findAll method

properties.name: isConnectorDetailsVisible
properties.description: Defines whether shapeConnectorList is displayed upon the click of connector/relationship or not

properties.name: rowHighlightFill
properties.description: The rowHighlightFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed

properties.name: rowHighlightAndHoverFill
properties.description: The rowHighlightAndHoverFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted and hovered rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed

properties.name: horizontalLazyLoadingEnabled
properties.description: Set to true if Gantt chart is configured to be lazy loaded horizontally. Application should fetch the data only for the visible horizon. Application also should make sure to fetch the relevant data on user interactions like horizontal scroll, zoom out, bird eye which changes the visible horizon until the time when all the data is fetched. This property has to be used with setAllDataLoadedPromise().

properties.name: enablePseudoShapes
properties.description: Optimizes the rendering of overlapping shapes

properties.name: shapeMouseEnterDelay
properties.description: Time in milliseconds where the mouse has to be on the same shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseEnter event

properties.name: shapeMouseLeaveDelay
properties.description: Time in milliseconds where the mouse has moved out of the hovered shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseLeave event

properties.name: shapeRenderOrder
properties.description: Comma-separated value of shape aggregations to decide the rendering order The aggregations first in the array are rendered first. Aggregations not mentioned in the array will be rendered at the very first Example: "shapes3,shapes2,shapes1" means shapes3 will be rendered at the bottom, and shapes1 will be rendered at the top

properties.name: enableMultipleGhosts
properties.description: Flag to enable displaying multiple ghosts when multiple shapes are selected and dragged.

properties.name: optimiseRelationships
properties.description: Configuration that optimizes relationship rendering behaviour by avoiding the rendering of non-interactive relationships. When the flag is enabled, a relationship instance is required in both the predecessor and successor rows, where the shapeTypeStart, and shapeTypeEnd property of relationship are set to default.

aggregations.name: table
aggregations.description:
Table of the Gantt Chart

You can use {sap.ui.table.Table} if you have a flat list data or {sap.ui.table.TreeTable} if you have hierarchical data.

aggregations.name: adhocLines
aggregations.description: The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

aggregations.name: simpleAdhocLines
aggregations.description: The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

aggregations.name: deltaLines
aggregations.description: The aggregation is used to store configuration of Delta Lines

aggregations.name: svgDefs
aggregations.description: SVG reusable element definitions. If this property is provided, the paint server definition of the SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed in in this property. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

aggregations.name: _pseudoSvgDefs
aggregations.description: SVG reusable element definitions for pseudo shapes.

aggregations.name: shapeSchemes
aggregations.description: Shape schemes of Gantt Chart. Defines all the possible shape schemes in the Gantt chart control. Note:If you don't use expand chart, you can omit this aggregations. If not set, a default sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme is provided automatically.

aggregations.name: calendarDef
aggregations.description: Paint servers consumed by special shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar. This aggregation is designed to improve performance of calendar shapes. Rows usually share a similar definition with calendar shapes. It is possible to define a Calendar paint server to draw only one rectangle for each row. Notes for classes extended from sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDef: Different from property paintServerDefs, paint servers defined here must implement method getDefNode() instead of method getDefString().

aggregations.name: axisTimeStrategy
aggregations.description: This aggregation controls the zoom strategies and zoom rate in Gantt Chart.

aggregations.name: locale
aggregations.description: Configuration of locale settings. Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time options are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

aggregations.name: _splitter
aggregations.description: private aggregation for resizing the selection panel

aggregations.name: _header
aggregations.description: Header of the Gantt Chart

aggregations.name: _innerGantt
aggregations.description: Inner Gantt chart

aggregations.name: ganttAdaptationData
aggregations.description: Specifies a data structure with arbitrary key value pairs to support customization of Gantt charts with tables.

aggregations.name: overflowToolbarItems
aggregations.description: Items can be added in chart overflow toolbar using this aggregation.

aggregations.name: shapeStyles
aggregations.description: Configuration for the Gantt chart styles. This Aggregation will override shapeStyles aggregation of ganttChartContainer.

cursorDateTime.description: Represent the cursor date & time when drop event fired

newDateTime.name: newDateTime
newDateTime.description:
The startTime or endTime of a dropped shape. In Free or Horizontal drag orientation, the value depends on the ghost alignment:
  • Start: newDateTime is the shape new start time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
  • None: newDateTime is the shape new start time
  • End: newDateTime is the shape new end time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
In Veritcal drag orientation, newDateTime is the shape new start time, and not equal with cursorDateTime in usual.

cursorDateTime.description: Represent the cursor date & time when drop event fired

newDateTime.name: newDateTime
newDateTime.description:
The startTime or endTime of a dropped shape. In Free or Horizontal drag orientation, the value depends on the ghost alignment:
  • Start: newDateTime is the shape new start time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
  • None: newDateTime is the shape new start time
  • End: newDateTime is the shape new end time, newDateTime is equal with cursorDateTime
In Veritcal drag orientation, newDateTime is the shape new start time, and not equal with cursorDateTime in usual.

methods.name: getAdhocLineLayer

returnValue.description: Value of property adhocLineLayer

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getAdhocLineLayer adhocLineLayer}. Specifies on which layer adhoc lines reside. By default, adhoc lines are on top of all other shapes and patterns. Default value is library.AdhocLineLayer.Top.

methods.name: getAdhocLines
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getAdhocLines adhocLines}.

The aggregation is used to store configuration of adhoc lines, adhoc lines represent milestones and events in axis time.

methods.name: getAxisTime

returnValue.description: the AxisTime instance

methods.description: This is a shortcut method for GanttChart instance to get the AxisTime.

methods.name: getAxisTimeStrategy
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getAxisTimeStrategy axisTimeStrategy}.

This aggregation controls the zoom strategies and zoom rate in Gantt Chart.

methods.name: getCalendarDef
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getCalendarDef calendarDef}. Paint servers consumed by special shape sap.gantt.shape.cal.Calendar. This aggregation is designed to improve performance of calendar shapes. Rows usually share a similar definition with calendar shapes. It is possible to define a Calendar paint server to draw only one rectangle for each row. Notes for classes extended from sap.gantt.def.cal.CalendarDef: Different from property paintServerDefs, paint servers defined here must implement method getDefNode() instead of method getDefString().

methods.name: getChartOverflowToolbar
methods.description: Returns the gantt chart overflow toolbar instance.

methods.name: getDatePattern

returnValue.description: Value of property datePattern

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDatePattern datePattern}. Specifies how the application's date is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "dd.MM.yyyy" (31.01.2018) Default value is library.config.DEFAULT_DATE_PATTERN.

methods.name: getDeltaAreaHighlightColor

returnValue.description: Value of property deltaAreaHighlightColor

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDeltaAreaHighlightColor deltaAreaHighlightColor}. Property to add custom color to the highlighted area between delta lines. This would default to Fiori standard color Default value is "sapUiListSelectionBackgroundColor".

methods.name: getDeltaLineLayer

returnValue.description: Value of property deltaLineLayer

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDeltaLineLayer deltaLineLayer}. Specifies the layer on which Delta Lines reside. By default, Delta Lines are above all shapes and patterns. Default value is library.DeltaLineLayer.Bottom.

methods.name: getDeltaLines
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getDeltaLines deltaLines}.

The aggregation is used to store configuration of Delta Lines

methods.name: getDisableShapeDoubleClickEvent

returnValue.description: Value of property disableShapeDoubleClickEvent

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getDisableShapeDoubleClickEvent disableShapeDoubleClickEvent}. Disables or enables the shapeDoubleClick event. If set to true, the shapeDoubleClick event is disabled. Default value is false.

methods.name: getDisplayType

returnValue.description: Value of property displayType

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDisplayType displayType}. Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.
  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}. Default value is Both.

methods.name: getDragOrientation

returnValue.description: Value of property dragOrientation

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getDragOrientation dragOrientation}. Drag orientation of Gantt Chart. This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:
  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.
Default value is Free.

methods.name: getEnableAdhocLine

returnValue.description: Value of property enableAdhocLine

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableAdhocLine enableAdhocLine}. Flag to show or hide adhoc lines representing milestones and events along the time axis Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableChartDeltaAreaHighlight

returnValue.description: Value of property enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableChartDeltaAreaHighlight enableChartDeltaAreaHighlight}. Flag to show or hide Chart Delta Area highlighting Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableChartHoverState

returnValue.description: Value of property enableChartHoverState

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableChartHoverState enableChartHoverState}. Option to disable or enable the chart row's hover state. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableChartOverflowToolbar

returnValue.description: Value of property enableChartOverflowToolbar

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableChartOverflowToolbar enableChartOverflowToolbar}. Option to show or hide the chart overflow toolbar. Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableChartSelectionState

returnValue.description: Value of property enableChartSelectionState

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableChartSelectionState enableChartSelectionState}. Option to disable or enable the chart row's selection state. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableCursorLine

returnValue.description: Value of property enableCursorLine

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableCursorLine enableCursorLine}. Flag whether to show or hide the cursor line when moving your mouse cursor Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableDeltaLine

returnValue.description: Value of property enableDeltaLine

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableDeltaLine enableDeltaLine}. Flag to show or hide Delta Lines Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableExpandedRowBackground

returnValue.description: Value of property enableExpandedRowBackground

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableExpandedRowBackground enableExpandedRowBackground}. Property to enable the background color for expanded rows. By default, this would show the row background Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableExpandedRowBorders

returnValue.description: Value of property enableExpandedRowBorders

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableExpandedRowBorders enableExpandedRowBorders}. Property to enable borders for expanded rows. By default, only row borders are enabled. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableLassoInvert

returnValue.description: Value of property enableLassoInvert

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableLassoInvert enableLassoInvert}. Enables inversion on shape selection while drawing lasso Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableMultipleGhosts

returnValue.description: Value of property enableMultipleGhosts

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableMultipleGhosts enableMultipleGhosts}. Flag to enable displaying multiple ghosts when multiple shapes are selected and dragged. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableNonWorkingTime

returnValue.description: Value of property enableNonWorkingTime

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableNonWorkingTime enableNonWorkingTime}. Flag to show or hide non-working time Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableNowLine

returnValue.description: Value of property enableNowLine

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableNowLine enableNowLine}. Flag whether to show or hide the present time indicator. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnablePseudoShapes

returnValue.description: Value of property enablePseudoShapes

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnablePseudoShapes enablePseudoShapes}. Optimizes the rendering of overlapping shapes Default value is false.

methods.name: getEnableSelectAndDrag

returnValue.description: Value of property enableSelectAndDrag

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableSelectAndDrag enableSelectAndDrag}. Allows to drag, drop, and resize a shape on explicitly selecting the shape. Default value is true.

methods.name: getEnableVerticalLine

returnValue.description: Value of property enableVerticalLine

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getEnableVerticalLine enableVerticalLine}. Flag to show or hide vertical lines representing intervals along the time axis Default value is true.

methods.name: getExpandedRowHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property expandedRowHeight

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getExpandedRowHeight expandedRowHeight}.

Property to define the height of an expanded row in pixels.

methods.name: getFindBy

returnValue.description: Value of property findBy

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFindBy findBy}. Defines the property names for which findAll method should search in different entities Default value is [].

methods.name: getFindByOperator

returnValue.description: Value of property findByOperator

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getFindByOperator findByOperator}. Defines relationship between the operator and the property names using the findAll method Default value is library.simple.findByOperator.OR.

methods.name: getGanttAdaptationData
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getGanttAdaptationData ganttAdaptationData}.

Specifies a data structure with arbitrary key value pairs to support customization of Gantt charts with tables.

methods.name: getGhostAlignment

returnValue.description: Value of property ghostAlignment

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getGhostAlignment ghostAlignment}. The dragging ghost alignment of Gantt Chart. This property define the visual effect of ghost position on dragging, it also effect the parameter value in event shapeDragEnd Default value is library.dragdrop.GhostAlignment.None.

methods.name: getHeight

returnValue.description: Value of property height

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHeight height}. Height of the control. Default value is "100%".

methods.name: getHighlightedShapeUid

returnValue.description: Array of shape object

methods.description: Get the highlighted shape in gantt chart

methods.name: getHorizontalLazyLoadingEnabled

returnValue.description: Value of property horizontalLazyLoadingEnabled

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getHorizontalLazyLoadingEnabled horizontalLazyLoadingEnabled}. Set to true if Gantt chart is configured to be lazy loaded horizontally. Application should fetch the data only for the visible horizon. Application also should make sure to fetch the relevant data on user interactions like horizontal scroll, zoom out, bird eye which changes the visible horizon until the time when all the data is fetched. This property has to be used with setAllDataLoadedPromise(). Default value is false.

methods.name: getIsConnectorDetailsVisible

returnValue.description: Value of property isConnectorDetailsVisible

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getIsConnectorDetailsVisible isConnectorDetailsVisible}. Defines whether shapeConnectorList is displayed upon the click of connector/relationship or not Default value is false.

methods.name: getLocale
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getLocale locale}. Configuration of locale settings. Most locale settings can be configured in sap.ui.configuration objects. Only the time zone and day-light-saving time options are provided by locale settings. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.config.Locale. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

methods.name: getMetadata

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

methods.description: Returns a metadata object for class sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable.

methods.name: getNowLineInUTC

returnValue.description: Value of property nowLineInUTC

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getNowLineInUTC nowLineInUTC}. Flag whether to show the nowLine in UTC or in FLP time. Default value is true.

methods.name: getOptimiseRelationships

returnValue.description: Value of property optimiseRelationships

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getOptimiseRelationships optimiseRelationships}. Configuration that optimizes relationship rendering behaviour by avoiding the rendering of non-interactive relationships. When the flag is enabled, a relationship instance is required in both the predecessor and successor rows, where the shapeTypeStart, and shapeTypeEnd property of relationship are set to default. Default value is false.

methods.name: getOverflowToolbarItems
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getOverflowToolbarItems overflowToolbarItems}.

Items can be added in chart overflow toolbar using this aggregation.

methods.name: getPrintingBatchSize

returnValue.description: Value of property printingBatchSize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getPrintingBatchSize printingBatchSize}. Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing. Default value is 100.

methods.name: getRelationshipShapeSize

returnValue.description: Value of property relationshipShapeSize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRelationshipShapeSize relationshipShapeSize}. Specifies the size of the relationship's shape. Applicable to triangles, square, diamond, and circle shapes; excluding horizontal rectangle and vertical rectangle shapes. Default value is Medium.

methods.name: getRowHighlightAndHoverFill

returnValue.description: Value of property rowHighlightAndHoverFill

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRowHighlightAndHoverFill rowHighlightAndHoverFill}. The rowHighlightAndHoverFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted and hovered rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed Default value is "sapChart_Sequence_1_Plus1".

methods.name: getRowHighlightFill

returnValue.description: Value of property rowHighlightFill

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getRowHighlightFill rowHighlightFill}. The rowHighlightFill property defines the color that is filled for the highlighted rows when a shape is being dragged The highlighted rows are the ones where the shape drop is allowed Default value is "sapChart_Sequence_1_Plus3".

methods.name: getSelectedShapeId

returnValue.description: Array of shape IDs

methods.description: Get the shape IDs for selected shapes in the gantt chart.

methods.name: getSelectedShapeUid

returnValue.description: Array of shape object

methods.description: Get selected shapes in gantt chart.

methods.name: getSelectionPanelSize

returnValue.description: Value of property selectionPanelSize

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectionPanelSize selectionPanelSize}. The width of selection panel. In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter. Default value is "30%".

methods.name: getSelectOnlyGraphicalShape

returnValue.description: Value of property selectOnlyGraphicalShape

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getSelectOnlyGraphicalShape selectOnlyGraphicalShape}. Enables selection of only graphical shapes excluding labels. Default value is false.

methods.name: getShapeHighlightSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeHighlightSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeHighlightSettings shapeHighlightSettings}. A JSON object containing the shapeHighlightSettings that is used to configure shape highlight styles. If nothing is specified, then the default highlight styles (2px dashed black border) is set. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

methods.name: getShapeMouseEnterDelay

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeMouseEnterDelay

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeMouseEnterDelay shapeMouseEnterDelay}. Time in milliseconds where the mouse has to be on the same shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseEnter event Default value is 500.

methods.name: getShapeMouseLeaveDelay

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeMouseLeaveDelay

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeMouseLeaveDelay shapeMouseLeaveDelay}. Time in milliseconds where the mouse has moved out of the hovered shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseLeave event Default value is 500.

methods.name: getShapeOverRelationship

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeOverRelationship

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeOverRelationship shapeOverRelationship}. Specifies whether shape is rendered over relationship or relationship over shape when relationship leads through shape. If enabled, shapes are rendered over relationships. If disabled, relationships are rendered over shapes. Default value is true.

methods.name: getShapeRenderOrder

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeRenderOrder

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeRenderOrder shapeRenderOrder}. Comma-separated value of shape aggregations to decide the rendering order The aggregations first in the array are rendered first. Aggregations not mentioned in the array will be rendered at the very first Example: "shapes3,shapes2,shapes1" means shapes3 will be rendered at the bottom, and shapes1 will be rendered at the top Default value is [].

methods.name: getShapeSchemes
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getShapeSchemes shapeSchemes}. Shape schemes of Gantt Chart. Defines all the possible shape schemes in the Gantt chart control. Note:If you don't use expand chart, you can omit this aggregations. If not set, a default sap.gantt.simple.ShapeScheme is provided automatically.

methods.name: getShapeSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeSelectionMode

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeSelectionMode shapeSelectionMode}. Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed. The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true. Default value is MultiWithKeyboard.

methods.name: getShapeSelectionSettings

returnValue.description: Value of property shapeSelectionSettings

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getShapeSelectionSettings shapeSelectionSettings}. A JSON object containing the shapeSelectionSettings which will be used to configure shape selection styles. If nothing is specified, then the default selection styles (2px dashed red border) is set. New properties 'shapeColor' and 'fillOpacity' are introduced as of SAPUI5 1.85 release. Using these, you can configure color and opacity of highlighted shapes in a gantt chart. Below you can find a brief example 

{
   color: "@sapChart_Sequence_9_Plus2",
   strokeWidth: 2,
   strokeDasharray: "5,1"
   shapeColor: null,
   fillOpacity: 0
}

methods.name: getShapeStyles
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getShapeStyles shapeStyles}.

Configuration for the Gantt chart styles. This Aggregation will override shapeStyles aggregation of ganttChartContainer.

Default value is false.

methods.name: getSvgDefs
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getSvgDefs svgDefs}. SVG reusable element definitions. If this property is provided, the paint server definition of the SVG is rendered. Method getDefString() should be implemented by all paint server classes that are passed in in this property. We recommend that you set the type of this argument to sap.gantt.def.SvgDefs. Otherwise some properties you set may not function properly.

methods.name: getTable

Gets content of aggregation {@link #getTable table}.

Table of the Gantt Chart

You can use {sap.ui.table.Table} if you have a flat list data or {sap.ui.table.TreeTable} if you have hierarchical data.

methods.name: getTimePattern

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getTimePattern timePattern}. Specifies how the application's time is displayed in the gantt chart. For example: "hh:mm a" (12:05 PM) Default value is library.config.DEFAULT_TIME_PATTERN.

methods.description: Gets current value of property {@link #getUseParentShapeOnExpand useParentShapeOnExpand}. Determines if only tasks need to be used for rendering the expanded shapes. Subtasks are not required. Default value is false.

methods.name: jumpToPosition

parameters.name: vValue
parameters.description: A date object or a 14-digit timestamp string in this format: YYYYMMDDHHMMSS. An array can also be passed where the two values determine the start time and end time of the visible horizon.

methods.description:
Jumps to a given position on the time axis by updating the visible horizon.

Can be used to implement the function of 'Jump To First', 'Jump To Last' and 'Jump To Current'.

parameters.name: oEvent
parameters.description: must be structured as the following { control: table control, oColumns: [], an array of sorted columns, a column must have a new value oldValues: [], an array of old values for sorted columns }

methods.name: rebindTableRows

parameters.name: mParameters
parameters.description:
Table Rebind parameters Example: 
	
		rebindTableRows({
			path: "pathToMyTableEntity",
			filters: filters, //"filters" refer to the list all filters that need to be passed to filter my data
			sorter: sorters, //"sorters" refer to the list all sorters that need to be passed to sort my data
			parameters: params // "params" any additional parameters to be passed like select / expand / tree binding parameters
		})

methods.description: Bind rows of the table aggregtion with given parameters Also, create the promise to wait for inner gantt rendering

methods.name: setDisplayType

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDisplayType
parameters.description: New value for property displayType

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getDisplayType displayType}. Defines how the Gantt chart is displayed.
  • If set to Both, both the table and the chart are displayed.
  • If set to Chart, only the chart is displayed.
  • If set to Table, only the table is displayed.
When the parent element of the Gantt chart is the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}, this property overrides the displayType property of {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Both.

methods.name: setDragOrientation

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sDragOrientation
parameters.description: New value for property dragOrientation

methods.description:
Sets a new value for property {@link #getDragOrientation dragOrientation}. Drag orientation of Gantt Chart. This property doesn't limit the mouse cursor position but the dragging ghost position when dragging it around. This property has 3 values:
  • Free: The dragging ghost moves along with your mouse cursor.
  • Horizontal: The dragged ghost only moves horizontally, cross row dragging is restricted. You can use this mode if you only need to change the times of the dragging shape
  • Vertical: Notice Vertical works if only one shape is selected (regardless shapeSelectionMode), it's showing forbidden cursor style on multiple shape selections when you are dragging. You can use this vertical mode if you only want to change the assignment without changing shape times.
When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is Free.

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getOptimiseRelationships optimiseRelationships}. Configuration that optimizes relationship rendering behaviour by avoiding the rendering of non-interactive relationships. When the flag is enabled, a relationship instance is required in both the predecessor and successor rows, where the shapeTypeStart, and shapeTypeEnd property of relationship are set to default. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iPrintingBatchSize
parameters.description: New value for property printingBatchSize

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getPrintingBatchSize printingBatchSize}. Defines the batch size, that is the number of rows, to be printed per iteration. If set to 0, batching is disabled and the entire Gantt chart is printed. This could slow the performance and make the browser non-responsive. Note: Relationship lines can be interrupted if the start and end points are in different canvases. To minimize this effect, choose a bigger batch size, ensuring that the browser is responsive during printing. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 100.

methods.name: setSelectionPanelSize

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sSelectionPanelSize
parameters.description: New value for property selectionPanelSize

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectionPanelSize selectionPanelSize}. The width of selection panel. In sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable, the selectionPanelSize is the Table/TreeTable width in the embedded Splitter. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is "30%".

methods.name: setSelectOnlyGraphicalShape

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bSelectOnlyGraphicalShape
parameters.description: New value for property selectOnlyGraphicalShape

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSelectOnlyGraphicalShape selectOnlyGraphicalShape}. Enables selection of only graphical shapes excluding labels. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setShapeMouseEnterDelay

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iShapeMouseEnterDelay
parameters.description: New value for property shapeMouseEnterDelay

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShapeMouseEnterDelay shapeMouseEnterDelay}. Time in milliseconds where the mouse has to be on the same shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseEnter event When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 500.

methods.name: setShapeMouseLeaveDelay

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: iShapeMouseLeaveDelay
parameters.description: New value for property shapeMouseLeaveDelay

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShapeMouseLeaveDelay shapeMouseLeaveDelay}. Time in milliseconds where the mouse has moved out of the hovered shape for the specified time before triggering the shapeMouseLeave event When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is 500.

methods.name: setShapeOverRelationship

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShapeOverRelationship
parameters.description: New value for property shapeOverRelationship

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShapeOverRelationship shapeOverRelationship}. Specifies whether shape is rendered over relationship or relationship over shape when relationship leads through shape. If enabled, shapes are rendered over relationships. If disabled, relationships are rendered over shapes. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setShapeSelectionMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sShapeSelectionMode
parameters.description: New value for property shapeSelectionMode

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShapeSelectionMode shapeSelectionMode}. Shape selection mode of the Gantt Chart. This property controls whether single or multiple shapes can be selected. When the selection mode is changed, the current selection is removed. The shapeSelectionMode only works if selectable property on the defined Shape is set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is MultiWithKeyboard.

methods.name: setShowExportTableToExcel

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowExportTableToExcel

methods.name: setShowParentRowOnExpand

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowParentRowOnExpand
parameters.description: New value for property showParentRowOnExpand

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowParentRowOnExpand showParentRowOnExpand}. Option to show or hide the parent row on expand. This is applicable only for multi-activity row settings. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setShowShapeTimeOnDrag

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowShapeTimeOnDrag
parameters.description: New value for property showShapeTimeOnDrag

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowShapeTimeOnDrag showShapeTimeOnDrag}. Flag to show or hide the start time and end time of a shape when you drag it along the time line. The property takes effect if only one shape is selected or enableMultipleGhosts is set to false. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is false.

methods.name: setShowTextOnGhost

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: bShowTextOnGhost
parameters.description: New value for property showTextOnGhost

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getShowTextOnGhost showTextOnGhost}. Option to show or hide shape labels on ghost while dragging. The property takes effect only when enableMultipleGhosts is set to true. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is true.

methods.name: setSnapMode

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: sSnapMode
parameters.description: New value for property snapMode

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSnapMode snapMode}. Enables snapping of shapes to attach to the nearest visual element while dragging. When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is None.

methods.name: setSnapTimeInterval

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oSnapTimeInterval
parameters.description: New value for property snapTimeInterval

methods.description: Sets a new value for property {@link #getSnapTimeInterval snapTimeInterval}. Defines the least time taken in seconds for a shape to snap while in a particular zoom level. eg. { "4hour":{timeInterval:1800}, ---> 30mins Snap "1hour":{timeInterval:900} ---> 15mins Snap } When called with a value of null or undefined, the default value of the property will be restored. Default value is {}.

The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer#insertGanttChart} and {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer#addGanttChart} functionality of gantt chart container won't work in fullscreen mode.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTableDisplayType
symbols.description:
Gantt chart display types.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.GanttChartWithTableDisplayType'.

properties.name: Both
properties.description: The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} control displays both a table and a chart.

properties.name: Chart
properties.description: The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} control displays only a chart.

properties.name: Table
properties.description: The {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartWithTable} control displays only a table.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.GanttPrinting
symbols.description:
The GanttPrinting control enables you to export your Gantt chart as a PDF document.
Please note that the quality of the exported image in PDF is currently limited to a pixel density of 96 PPI and the area of the chart that can be exported is limited to a canvas area of 16,384 x 16,384 pixels (268,435,456 square pixels).

associations.name: ganttChart
associations.description: Gantt chart to be exported as PDF document.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSetting
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new GanttPrinting control. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: close
methods.description: Closes the print dialog.

methods.name: export
methods.description: Exports the Gantt chart as PDF.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.horizontalTextAlignment
symbols.description:
Configuration options for horizontal alignment of title of the shape representing a Task.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.horizontalTextAlignment'.

properties.name: Dynamic
properties.description: Shape title moves dynamically with horizontal scroll and zoom.

properties.name: End
properties.description: Shape title is aligned at the end of the x-axis.

properties.name: Middle
properties.description: Shape title is aligned at the center of the x-axis.

properties.name: Start
properties.description: Shape title is aligned at the start of the x-axis.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.LegendColumnConfig
symbols.description: Enable users to define properties for shapes in one vertical line(column), each LegendColumnConfig affects one column.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: Once this property is set, shapes in one vertical line have the same fill color or fill pattern.

properties.name: fillFactory
properties.description: Factory function is used to determine the fill property for different shape classes defined in yDimension config. Shape name of the shape class is passed as a parameter to the function. The return value should be a color code.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: id for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for LegendColumnConfig. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

parameters.description: Constructor function for the metadata object; if not given, it defaults to the metadata implementation used by this class

returnValue.description: Value of property fill

Gets current value of property {@link #getFill fill}.

Once this property is set, shapes in one vertical line have the same fill color or fill pattern.

methods.name: getFillFactory

returnValue.description: Value of property fillFactory

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getFillFactory fillFactory}.

Factory function is used to determine the fill property for different shape classes defined in yDimension config. Shape name of the shape class is passed as a parameter to the function. The return value should be a color code.

returnValue.description: Metadata object describing this class

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.LegendContainer
symbols.description:
The LegendContainer control uses the NavContainer control to handle hierarchical navigation between legend sections. The LegendContainer control contains an initial navigation page. Both the initial navigation page and legend sections are Page controls, We put the List Legend control inside the Page control internally.

If you only add one legend, the initial navigation page won't display. Whenever you open legend container, the legend container will restore the page last time you quit with.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.width of the legend navigation. When the width specified is smaller than a section content, a horizontal scroll bar appears.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the legend navigation. When the height specified is smaller than a section content, a vertical scroll bar appears.

properties.name: enableFlatLegends
properties.description: shows all the list legends in flat structure instead of navigation list. restriction - will work only with list legends.

aggregations.name: legends
aggregations.description: Legends inside the container, they could be instances of List Legend or Dimension Legend.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Creates and initializes a new legend container. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: addLegend

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

parameters.name: oLegend
parameters.description: The legend to add; if empty, nothing is inserted

methods.description: Adds some legend to the aggregation {@link #getLegends legends}.

methods.name: destroyLegends

returnValue.description: Reference to this in order to allow method chaining

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.PrintConfig
symbols.description: PrintConfig is a class that holds the configuration for the print page.

parameters.name: printConfiguartionObject
parameters.description:
The print configuration object can have keys as pageConfig, textConfig, marginConfig, durationConfig, exportConfig and with values as defined in below structure.
    pageConfig - The page configuration object with the following given keys.
  • paperSize: Possible values are "A0" | "A1" | "A2" | "A3" | "A4" | "A5" | "Letter" | "Legal" | "Tabloid" | "Custom". Select one of the provided values as the paper size of the print page. Default value is "A4".
  • unit: Possible values are "mm" | "cm" | "in". Select one of the provided values as the unit for paper and margin measurements. Default value is "mm" for all paper size except "Letter", "Legal", "Tabloid" where default value is "in".
  • paperHeight: It must be a number, and it must be the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when paper size is "Custom". If paper size is not provided, then the default value is height of the "A4" paper size.
  • paperWidth: It must be a number, and it must be the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when the paper size is "Custom". If paper size is not provided, then "A4" is the default width.
  • portrait: It must be a boolean value as it is the orientation of the page. Default value is true.
  • showPageNumber: It must be a boolean value. It decides if the page number is to be displayed. Default value is false. Not applicable in single page API.
    textConfig - The text configuration with the following given keys.
  • showHeaderText: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to show the header text or not in the print page. Default value is false.
  • showFooterText: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to show the footer text or not in the print page. Default value is false.
  • headerText: It must be a string value to display header text in the print page. Default value is empty string.
  • footerText: It must be a string value to display footer text in the print page. Default value is empty string.
    marginConfig - The margin configuration object with the following given keys.
  • marginType: Possible values are "custom" | "none" | "default". Select one of the provided values for the margin type of the print page. Default value is "default".
  • marginLeft: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginBottom: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginRight: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginTop: It must be a number and it must be in the unit specified within the page configuration. It is considered only when margin type is set as "custom". When the margin type is "default", the default value is "5mm". If "none" is maintained, then the value is "0".
  • marginLocked: It must be a boolean value. If set to true, it signifies all four margins get synced on the same value. If the value is provided by the application, the margin top is considered for all four margins. Default value is false and considered only when the margin type is "custom".
    durationConfig - The duration configuration object with following given keys.
  • duration: Possible values are "all" | "week" | "month" | "custom". Select the date duration of the print page. Default value is "all".
    • If the provided value is "all", then the total horizon is set as duration. Values provided in "startDate" and "endDate" are ignored.
    • If the provided value is "week", then the next week is set as duration. Values provided in "startDate" and "endDate" are ignored.
    • If the provided value is "month", then the next month is set as duration. Values provided in "startDate" and "endDate" are ignored.
    • If the provided value is "custom", then the value provided in "startDate" and "endDate" is set as duration.
  • startDate: This is a UI5 date object. It is the start date of a print page. It is considered only when the "duration" is set as "custom".
  • endDate: This is a UI5 date object. It is the end date of a print page. It is considered only when the "duration" is set as "custom".
    exportConfig - The export configuration object with the following given keys.
  • exportAsJPEG: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to export the pdf as a JPEG or not. Default value is true, which means that the exported PDF has content in a JPEG image format. This is not applicable for single page API.
  • exportRange: It must be a string value such as, '0,1". It is the range of the export. This is not applicable for a single page API and when "exportAll" is set to true.
  • exportAll: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether to export all the pages or not. Default value is true. This is not applicable for a single page API.
  • compressionQuality: It must be a number between the range of 1 to 100. The quality of the compression is applicable only when "exportAsJPEG" is set to true. Default value is 75. This is not applicable for a single page API.
  • scale: It must be a number between the range of 50 to 100. This is to scale the export up or down. Default value is 100. This is not applicable for a single page API.
  • multiplePage: It must be a boolean value. It is a flag to decide whether if the export is multiple page. This is not applicable for a single page API.
    If the configuration is incorrect, errors with the following codes are shown.
  • TYPE_ERROR - If the type of the property is not as expected.
  • RANGE_ERROR - If the value of the property is not in the expected range or not in the list specified.
  • REQUIRED_ERROR - If the required property is missing.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.shapes.Shape
symbols.description:
Base class for all standard shapes.

This class provides the common used properties and methods useful for shape rendering. Use this class as a parent of your custom shape implementations.

properties.name: color
properties.description: Color to be used for rendering the shape.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Height defines the vertical length of the shape.

By default, the system automatically generates the shape height according to the base row height. You can set the height yourself by using the setter method. However, it cannot exceed the row height.

properties.name: width
properties.description: The horizontal width of a shape. Auto will be converted to width calculated from time and endTime.

properties.name: startX
properties.description: The x position of the shapes start. Auto will be converted to position based on time.

properties.name: selectable
properties.description: All standard shapes are selectable.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.ShapeStyle
symbols.description: class handles style properties for shapes. Different styles can be defined for different event states.

properties.name: name
properties.description: The name of the Shape style. This is a mandatory field. The name should be unique.

properties.name: eventState
properties.description: This property defines the event for which the style should be applied. This is a mandatory field. For example, if the eventState is "dragDrop", the style is applied to ghost image of shape on drag.

properties.name: stroke
properties.description: The stroke property is a presentation property defining the color (or any SVG paint servers like gradients or patterns) used to paint the outline of the shape.

properties.name: strokeWidth
properties.description: The strokeWidth property is a presentation property defining the width of the stroke to be applied to the shape.

properties.name: strokeDasharray
properties.description: The strokeDasharray property is a presentation property defining the pattern of dashes and gaps used to paint the outline of the shape.

properties.name: fill
properties.description: For shapes and text, the fill property is a presentation attribute that defines the color (or any SVG paint server like gradients or patterns)

properties.name: textFill
properties.description: Text color property.

properties.name: visible

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.StockChartPeriod
symbols.description:
StockChartPeriod is used by sap.gantt.simple.StockChart It represents a time period that a specific stock usages If the tooltip aggregation is defined for a stock chart period, it is used to render the tooltip. If explicitly set to " ", no tooltip is shown. If the tooltip aggregation is not provided, a default tooltip is displayed in the format - dimension name:period value.

StockChartPeriod is defined as an aggregation of sap.gantt.simple.StockChartDimension

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationBarChart
symbols.description:
Utilization Bar Chart (UBC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize a resource the capacity and actual consumption of a resource.

There is a `line` in UBC to visualize the actual capacity consumption, you can change the `line` color by property stroke

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.UtilizationLineChart
symbols.description:
Utilization Line Chart (ULC) is a complex shape, you can use it to visualize resource utilization on different dimensions. Each Utilization dimension is represented by a line, you could define different colors for each dimension.

You can define the ULC background by property fill, the default background color is light gray

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.verticalTextAlignment
symbols.description:
Configuration options for vertical alignment of title of the shape representing a Task.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.verticalTextAlignment'.

properties.name: Bottom
properties.description: Shape title is aligned at the bottom of the shape.

properties.name: Center
properties.description: Shape title is aligned at the center of the shape.

properties.name: Top
properties.description: Shape title is aligned at the top of the shape.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType
symbols.description:
This specifies the sub reason detailing why the visible horizon is changing

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType'.

properties.name: NotApplicable
properties.description: Default value of VisibleHorizonUpdateSubType when VisibleHorizonUpdateType is other than ZoomLevelChanged.

properties.name: ZoomIn
properties.description: The Visible horizon is updated when zoomed in.

properties.name: ZoomOut
properties.description: The Visible horizon is updated when zoomed out.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType
symbols.description:
This type specifies the reason why visible horizon is changing.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.VisibleHorizonUpdateType'.

properties.name: HorizontalScroll
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when a user scrolls using the Gantt chart horizontal scroll bar.

properties.name: InitialRender
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when Gantt chart gets rendered (which is triggered by an onAfterRenderer event) and needs to set visible horizon based on the chart configuration.

properties.name: MouseWheelZoom
properties.description: The update is triggered by the user scrolling horizontally with a mouse wheel (Ctrl + Shift + mouse wheel).

properties.name: SyncVisibleHorizon
properties.description: The update is triggered by the {@link sap.gantt.simple.GanttChartContainer}. This update is used to keep all Gantt charts in one container in sync. When the user performs an action that changes the visible horizon, an event with the action type is fired on the original Gantt chart and SyncVisibleHorizon gets fired on all other Gantt charts in the container.

properties.name: TimePeriodZooming
properties.description: An update happens when the user selects a time period using the Z key + mouse.

properties.name: TotalHorizonUpdated
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when the total horizon of a Gantt chart changes or is set. Changes in total horizon may affect the visible horizon as well.

properties.name: ZoomLevelChanged
properties.description: The visible horizon is updated when the zoom level is changed, either by the user or the application.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.simple.yAxisColumnContent
symbols.description:
Configaration option for yAxis Column.

This enum is part of the 'sap/gantt/library' module export and must be accessed by the property 'simple.yAxisColumnContent'.

properties.name: OnlyThreshold
properties.description: yAis column has only threshold with width of 52px.

properties.name: ThresholdwithLabel
properties.description: yAxis column has threshold and label with width of 124px.

properties.name: ThresholdwithLabelandUOM
properties.description: yAxis column has threshold, label and UOM with Width of 192px.

properties.name: ThresholdwithUOM
properties.description: yAxis column has threshould and UOM with width of 128px.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.SVGLength
symbols.description: A length is a distance measurement, given as a number along with a unit. If unit is not provided, the length value represents a distance in the current user coordinate system.

symbols.name: sap.gantt.ValueSVGPaintServer
symbols.description:
A string type that represents SVG fill color values.

Allowed values are {@link sap.ui.core.CSSColor} and {@link sap.m.ValueColor} and LESS parameter The empty string and invalid less parameter fall back to default black color.
